title: Decoupled registration platform for all Architects in the Netherlands
excerpt: A new home for the Architects Register

paragraphs.text: In collaboration with designers Sjoerd Koopmans and Jan-Roelof de Vries from RichDust and the developers at Rox Digital Agency, we have undergone an intensive process over the past year to develop a new website for the Bureau Architectenregister. The Architectenregister is jointly responsible for the professional competence of nearly 14,000 registered interior architects, architects, landscape architects, and urban planners.

A technical challenge was incorporating and visualizing the register itself. Additionally, architectenregister.nl provides information about the registration process, links to registration forms, and a very extensive range of further education and training opportunities for its members.

We wanted to offer an innovative site, and naturally, this also involves new technology. While this posed a challenge for a website of this scale, we aimed for a 'decoupled architecture,' and it has paid off. This means the Frontend runs in a standalone environment and retrieves its data from specific data endpoints.

The new architectenregister was built with a Laravel CMS (Statamic), implemented by Rox, which serves as the API for a Vue(3)/Nuxt(3) application. This also enabled the creation of an external site search using Algolia (delivering excellent search speed) and offers future potential to connect with other sources/APIs.

slides.caption: The whole picture at a glance

paragraphs.text: In collaboration with the designers at Silo, we worked with great pleasure on the new silo.nl. With their striking designs and acclaimed, award-winning projects, Silo has long been a prominent player in the Dutch design landscape, and it’s an honor to work for and with this studio. The redefinition of their business strategy and an increasing focus on the international market were key reasons to give the website a thorough update.

The design is sleek and minimalist, requiring extra attention to typography and placement. A crucial aspect of this website was providing editorial freedom through various visual modules. These allow images, videos, quotes, and texts to be beautifully presented on the page.

Additionally, a blog is included in the form of the 'Journal' page, offering the option to assign a unique theme color to each blog post. This project utilized the latest version of Nuxt, Nuxt 3. For content management, WordPress proved to be the ideal solution. Thanks to WordPress’s REST API, a modern JavaScript framework-based site could be built while remaining easy to manage from the WP dashboard.

title: Groote Museum Blikvanger
excerpt: Progressive Web App for ARTIS Groote Museum

paragraphs.text: ARTIS Amsterdam reopened its Groote Museum to the public in May 2022. After an extensive renovation, it once again provides an opportunity to gain knowledge shared by the Natura Artis Magistra Society, offering a glimpse into the wonders of nature.

For this exhibition, Sjoerd Oudman studio developed a PWA (Progressive Web App) in collaboration with designer Edgar Walthert to enhance the museum visit. The app can be accessed via a browser or installed as a standalone application on a phone. With this PWA, visitors can view the museum map and enter two words for each 'zone,' which generates a unique outcome at the end of the visit.

title: iKOT vernieuwde website
excerpt: Student housing platform on a VILT stack

paragraphs.text: iKot is the market leader in Belgium for online student housing. iKot is comparable to the Dutch platform kamernet.nl. The platform provides students with the opportunity to find a room in one of Belgium's major cities. The platform is used by thousands of students every day.

In collaboration with Floris Douma this platform has been completely revamped and rebuilt using a VILT (Vue, Inertia, Laravel, Tailwind) stack. This stack combines the powerful yet highly flexible Laravel with Vue, with Inertia acting as the interface between them. This approach enables a large and demanding platform like iKot to run efficiently while taking full advantage of a modern frontend framework.
The new website went live in June 2023.

title: Hunger exhibition website
excerpt: Website for the iET Hunger in Kunsthal Rotterdam

paragraphs.text: Hunger is a multidisciplinary exhibition based on the autobiographical album of the same name by musician iET (Lisa van Viegen Mokoginta) and designer Rich Dust (Sjoerd Koopmans). The exhibition took place in Kunsthal Rotterdam from 18 February till 5th June 2022.

For this exhibition and the online presentation of the new album, iET's website has been updated. It is now possible to listen to the new album directly on the site. Each track on the album has its own dedicated page. The concept is to create a digital version of the artwork traditionally included with a physical record or CD. While listening to the music, visitors can view the artwork, and each track is accompanied by a text written by lyricist Marianne Clason.
The site also features a calendar with upcoming performances, powered by the SongKick API. The website can be viewed at ietmusic.com.

title: Taking Stock
excerpt: Digital archive of the Townhouse Gallery in Caïro

paragraphs.text: Artists Elke Uitentuis, Wouter Osterholt, and Mariam Elnozahy organized a series of interactive drawing sessions in an installation at the former Townhouse Gallery. This installation commemorates the closure of the Townhouse Gallery, which was lost due to political unrest and instability in Egypt. The sessions were held in the summer of 2021.

The website, developed collaboration with designer Olga Oudman, is built as a deliberately chaotic search engine where the conversations that took place during these sessions can be read again. The website also displays the drawings created during these sessions. The website was also an integral part of the 'Taking Stock' exhibition that took place at Framer Framed in 2021.

title: Hizkia Corporate site
excerpt: Corporate site for one of Europe's leading art transport companies

paragraphs.text: Hizkia is no small player when it comes to transporting art within Europe. With locations from Paris to Stockholm, they supply major museums such as the Rijksmuseum and KMSKA.
Hizkia was in need of a new website where all their activities, and especially the contact information for their many locations, could be easily found.

A new design was created by the design bureau All This from Rotterdam, and in collaboration with the team from Jannes en Mannes, who acted as project managers and provided the framework on which the site was built, a new website was realized in a relatively short amount of time.
The new website went live in the early spring of 2023.
